scenarioDescription:
The HD 1690 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 1690 is a star with 1.86 times the mass of the Sun, and 21.66 times its radius. It is located 2454.70 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 1690 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 1690 system


HD 1690 b

HD 1690 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2011-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 1690 b is 2795.220 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 1690 b is 12.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 1690 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 1690, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 1690 - System With 1 Exoplanet
